data.name: Fundamentals: Practice with Data Types
data.description:
# Practice with Data Types

We will be practicing with 5 fundamental data types today: Integers, Floats, Booleans, Strings, and Lists. Given an input variable, determine the data type of that input and apply the appropriate transformation from the examples below:

### Examples

```
| Data Type | Transformation |     Example Input     |    Example Output     |
|    int    |     add 2      |         100           |        102            |
|   float   | divide in half |         10.8          |        5.4            |
|    str    |    lowercase   |     "Hello World"     |     "hello world"     |
|    bool   |   return str   |         False         |       "False"         |
|    list   |   return size  |     ['a','b','c']     |          3            |
```

This will test your ability to handle multiple data types coming into the same function as well as basic fundamental operations you can perform on any one of these data types. You will NOT need to worry about inupts that are other datatypes besides these 5.
